Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Childish \Child"ish\ (ch[imac]ld"[i^]sh), a. 1. Of, pertaining to, befitting, or resembling, a child. ``Childish innocence.'' --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
2. Puerile; trifling; weak. [1913 Webster]
Methinks that simplicity in her countenance is rather childish than innocent. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
Note: Childish, as applied to persons who are grown up, is in a disparaging sense; as, a childish temper. [1913 Webster]
